pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2b98b6b3de](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20721/commits/2b98b6b3deca407362154d6af0c665c6bdfbbf53)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.NonUnitalSubsemiring.Basic | 542 | 545 | +3 (+0.55%) |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.NonUnitalSubring.Basic | 601 | 604 | +3 (+0.50%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.Subsemiring.Basic | 603 | 604 | +1 (+0.17%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.Subring.Basic | 620 | 621 | +1 (+0.16%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>7 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Field.Subfield.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.Subring.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.Subsemiring.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Star.NonUnitalSubsemiring` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Integer` `Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleRing.Field` `Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Subfield`</details>|1|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.NonUnitalSubring.Basic` `Mathlib.RingTheory.NonUnitalSubsemiring.Basic`|3|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Submonoid.centerCongr`
`+ Submonoid.centerToMulOpposite`
`+ Subsemigroup.centerCongr`
`+ Subsemigroup.centerToMulOpposite`
`+ _root_.MulEquivClass.apply_mem_center`
`+ arrowCongrAddEquiv`
`+ conjRingEquiv`
`+ endRingEquiv`
`+++++ centerCongr`
`+++++ centerToMulOpposite`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
/-- A linear isomorphism between the domains and codomains of two spaces of linear maps gives a
additive isomorphism between the two function spaces.

See also `LinearEquiv.arrowCongr` for the linear version of this equivalence. -/
def arrowCongrAddEquiv (e₁ : M₁ ≃ₗ[R] M₂) (e₂ : M₂₁ ≃ₗ[R] M₂₂) :
```
and similarly for `conjRingEquiv` and `conj`.
This is is arguably backwards compared to the type of the equiv; either the docstring or statement should be flipped, I guess deciding based on some existing equivs in mathlib.

Given [RingEquiv.toOpposite](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Equiv.html#RingEquiv.toOpposite) it seems I should indeed switch the order ... I guess these are different from simp lemmas where you put the more complicated one on the left.
Let me change the names to `centerToMulOpposite` ...
Can you extract this as a `MulEquivClass.apply_mem_center` helper?

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra): `Mul/RingEquiv`s between `center` and `Module.End`
